page.title: 08THE CITY MUSEUM
page.content: The new City Museum and Art Gallery, Bethesda Street Hanley was officially opened by Prince Charles in 1981. The following year it received the"Museum of the Year" Award and is a popular local attraction. Children particularly like the natural history section where they can stroke some of the preserved animals.Other departments include Archaeology,Social History,Fine Arts, Decorative Arts and Ceramics.There is a bar and cafeteria,a bookshop and lecture hall facilties.Presently there is an important temporary exibition on view which traces the history of the city during this its double anniversary year.It is seventy five years since the federation of the six towns into the city of Stoke on Trent and in 1910 it received city status.The exhibition uses material from a recent manpower services historic buildings survey.
